dr_report_evaluation_qa.answer: Data-driven loyalty programs are enabling grocers to sustain growth amid inflation, with those integrating customer data into their strategies experiencing a 3.8% average increase in same-store sales, even in price-sensitive markets.

Modern consumers, particularly Gen Z and Millennials, prefer personalized, context-aware rewards over generic points. Grocery chains such as Tesco, Kroger, and Asda are transitioning to AI-driven, predictive offers that adapt in real time to shopper behavior, addressing "loyalty fatigue" and maintaining engagement with younger customers.

Retailers using AI and CRM data to align loyalty offers with inventory and shopping patterns enhance engagement and protect margins by timing personalized promotions with stock levels. This CRM-driven personalization leads to superior customer retention and sales growth compared to competitors.

dr_report_evaluation_qa.answer: Lee's Market has a customer retention rate of 62% as of Q2 2024.
